oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Clark's Old Water Mill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Exterior of a grist mill, known as Clark's Mill, or Clark's Old Water Mill on Smithville Highway.

It was built in 1860 and torn down for highway construction. Waman Clark (1822-1895) was the owner. The mill was operated by the family for many years. Waman Clark was a farmer and slave owner in White Co. Tn. His home was named Beechwood.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mills; Water mills; Flour & meal industry; Automobiles
